Class ec.ifc.stonelook.SLButton 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.View
           |
           +----netscape.application.Button
                   |
                   +----ec.ifc.app.ECButton
                           |
                           +----ec.ifc.stonelook.SLButton
public class SLButton
extends ECButton
implements HasColorScheme
Subclass of Button that applies the stone-texture look.

SLButton()

createCheckButton(int, int, int, int)
Returns an unchecked non-exclusive check button with the stone-texture look.
createPushButton(int, int, int)
Returns a push button with the stone-texture look.
createPushButton(int, int, int, int)
Returns a push button with the stone-texture look, with specified bounds.
createRadioButton(int, int, int, int)
Returns an unchecked exclusive radio button with the stone-texture look.
drawViewBackground(Graphics, Rect, boolean)
Overridden to draw marbled area
drawViewTitleInRect(Graphics, String, Font, Rect, int)
Overridden to get an embedded text effect on push button titles.
getColorScheme()
Returns the color scheme for this button -- one of the set specified by class StoneLook.
isDefault()
Returns whether this button should be drawn with the default-button look (i.e., the button in a window that responds to Enter or Return).
setColorScheme(int)
Sets the color scheme for this button, and schedules a redraw.
standardFont()
Returns the font used by default for new SLButtons.
standardPushButtonHeight()
Returns the height at which push buttons are created.

SLButton 
  public SLButton()

createCheckButton 
  public static Button createCheckButton(int x,
                                         int y,
                                         int width,
                                         int height)
Returns an unchecked non-exclusive check button with the stone-texture look. Parameters specify the rectangle in which the check button is drawn, left-aligned and vertically centered.
createRadioButton 
  public static Button createRadioButton(int x,
                                         int y,
                                         int width,
                                         int height)
Returns an unchecked exclusive radio button with the stone-texture look. Parameters specify the rectangle in which the radio button is drawn, left-aligned and vertically centered.
getColorScheme 
  public int getColorScheme()
Returns the color scheme for this button -- one of the set specified by class StoneLook. The default is StoneLook.BLUES.
setColorScheme 
  public void setColorScheme(int newColorScheme)
Sets the color scheme for this button, and schedules a redraw.
See Also:
getColorScheme
standardPushButtonHeight 
  public static int standardPushButtonHeight()
Returns the height at which push buttons are created. This height is chosen to make the standard border look right.
See Also:
createPushButton
standardFont 
  public static Font standardFont()
Returns the font used by default for new SLButtons.
createPushButton 
  public static SLButton createPushButton(int x,
                                          int y,
                                          int width)
Returns a push button with the stone-texture look. Parameters specify the top-left corner and width of the button. The height of the button is a constant determined by the height at which the special border looks good.
createPushButton 
  public static Button createPushButton(int x,
                                        int y,
                                        int width,
                                        int height)
Returns a push button with the stone-texture look, with specified bounds. Use this if you are specifying a non-standard height for the button, which will not look right with the default stone-look button border. Otherwise, use the version of this call that does not specify a height.
drawViewBackground 
  public void drawViewBackground(Graphics g,
                                 Rect interiorRect,
                                 boolean drawDownState)
Overridden to draw marbled area
Overrides:
drawViewBackground in class Button
drawViewTitleInRect 
  public void drawViewTitleInRect(Graphics g,
                                  String title,
                                  Font titleFont,
                                  Rect textBounds,
                                  int justification)
Overridden to get an embedded text effect on push button titles.
Overrides:
drawViewTitleInRect in class Button
isDefault 
  public boolean isDefault()
Returns whether this button should be drawn with the default-button look (i.e., the button in a window that responds to Enter or Return).
